SEARCH
Package Controller

Class PlayerController

java.lang.Object
Controller.PlayerController
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable
public class PlayerController extends Object implements Serializable
The PlayerController class manages player actions such as assigning countries, distributing armies, and creating orders.
Author:
Disha Padsala,Shrey Hingu,Akhilesh Kanbarkar
See Also:

  • Constructor Details

    • PlayerController

      public PlayerController()
      Default constructor for PlayerController.

  • Method Details

    • assignCountry

      public boolean assignCountry(CurrentState p_currentState)
      Assigns countries to players based on the number of available players and countries. This method ensures that each player gets a country from the map.
      Parameters:
      p_currentState - The current game state containing players and the map.
      Returns:
      true if countries are successfully assigned to players, false otherwise.

    • updatePlayerContinentOwnership

      public void updatePlayerContinentOwnership(List<Player> p_Players, List<Continent> p_MapContinents)
      Updates the player's ownership of continents based on country ownership.
      Parameters:
      p_Players - The list of players.
      p_MapContinents - The list of continents in the map.

    • displayAssignedCountries

      public void displayAssignedCountries(List<Player> p_Players)
      Displays the assigned countries for each player.
      Parameters:
      p_Players - The list of players.

    • randomCountryDistribution

      public void randomCountryDistribution(List<Player> p_Players, List<Country> p_Countries, int p_CountriesPerPlayer)
      Distributes countries randomly among players.
      Parameters:
      p_Players - The list of players.
      p_Countries - The list of countries.
      p_CountriesPerPlayer - The number of countries per player.

    • getNumberOfArmies

      public int getNumberOfArmies(Player p_Player)
      Gets the number of armies assigned to a player.
      Parameters:
      p_Player - The player.
      Returns:
      The number of armies.

    • assignArmies

      public void assignArmies(CurrentState p_CurrentState)
      Assigns armies to players based on the number of countries they own and continent bonuses.
      Parameters:
      p_CurrentState - The current game state containing players.

    • hasSufficientArmies

      private boolean hasSufficientArmies(Player p_Player, int p_NumberOfArmiesToDeploy)
      Checks if the player has sufficient armies to deploy.
      Parameters:
      p_Player - The player issuing the deploy order.
      p_NumberOfArmiesToDeploy - The number of armies the player wants to deploy.
      Returns:
      True if the player has enough unallocated armies, otherwise false.

    • validateCountryOwnership

      private boolean validateCountryOwnership(Player p_Player, String p_CountryName)
      Validates if the player owns the specified country.
      Parameters:
      p_Player - The player whose country ownership is being checked.
      p_CountryName - The name of the country to validate.
      Returns:
      True if the player owns the country, otherwise false.

    • isUnallocatedArmiesExist

      public boolean isUnallocatedArmiesExist(CurrentState p_currentState)
      Checks if any player has unallocated armies.
      Parameters:
      p_currentState - The current game state.
      Returns:
      True if unallocated armies exist, otherwise false.

    • isUnexecutedOrdersExist

      public boolean isUnexecutedOrdersExist(List<Player> p_playerList)
      Checks if any player in the given list has unexecuted orders.
      Parameters:
      p_playerList - the list of players to check for unexecuted orders
      Returns:
      true if any player has unexecuted orders, false otherwise

    • checkForMoreOrders

      public boolean checkForMoreOrders(List<Player> p_players)
      Checks whether any player in the provided list has more orders to issue.
      Parameters:
      p_players - the list of players to check.
      Returns:
      true if at least one player has more orders to issue; false otherwise.

    • assignContinentToPlayers

      public void assignContinentToPlayers(List<Player> p_players, List<Continent> p_mapContinents)
      Assigns continents to players if they own all the countries within a continent. A player is granted ownership of a continent if they already own all the countries in it.
      Parameters:
      p_players - the list of players to evaluate.
      p_mapContinents - the list of all continents in the game map.

    • resetPlayerFlag

      public void resetPlayerFlag(List<Player> p_playerList)
      Resets the player flags for the next turn. - Players (except Neutral) can issue more orders. - Each player's "one card per turn" flag is reset. - Any ongoing negotiations are reset.
      Parameters:
      p_playerList - List of players whose flags need to be reset.
